config_description: Cannot found this configuration description for this configuration.
developer_understanding_on_working: The _journalDiskSync configuration option is used in the code to determine whether disk synchronization should be performed in the PersistentJournal constructor. If _journalDiskSync is true, disk synchronization will be enabled, otherwise it will be disabled.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the _journalDiskSync configuration option depends on the value set for it. If _journalDiskSync is set to true, disk synchronization will be triggered every time a new journal entry is written to the disk. If _journalDiskSync is set to false, disk synchronization will not be triggered.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the _journalDiskSync configuration option on the system can be significant. Enabling disk synchronization (_journalDiskSync=true) can ensure data durability but may also introduce performance overhead due to the disk write operations. Disabling disk synchronization (_journalDiskSync=false) can improve performance but may increase the risk of data loss in case of system failure.
